Tips Berjualan Makanan Online agar Kualitas Terjaga
07 Nov 2019, 12:59 by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Para pebisnis mulai menjajakan dagangannya di toko online. Tak hanya pakaian saja, juga berbagai kebutuhan pangan seperti kopi dan bumbu masakan pun ditawarkan lewat internet.
Meski demikian, jika Anda adalah salah satu orang yang berminat untuk berjualan makanan daring, berbagai hal perlu diperhatikan. Menurut pemilik Rumah Bumbu Ratna, Abdul Wahab, seorang pedagang makanan online wajib memperhatikan waktu pembelian bahan baku.
Hal ini karena harga bahan baku yang fluktuatif. Misalnya cabai yang harganya melonjak saat mendekati acara besar seperti Ramadhan dan Natal.
“Sebaiknya kita stocking dari jauh-jauh hari karena order saat hari besar pasti ikut tinggi. Kita harus belajar supaya tidak rugi dan harganya tetap bersahabat untuk pembeli,” katanya dalam acara media gathering Tokopedia di Makassar pada 7 November 2019.
Bagi penjual makanan daring juga Wahab menyarankan untuk memilih perusahaan bidang pengiriman dan logistik yang terbaik. Misalnya, mereka yang memiliki jam terbang tinggi sehingga waktu pengiriman dipastikan tidak terlambat.
“Kalau bisa, pakai yang ekspres atau maksimal lima hari sampai kalau kirimnya antar pulau supaya makanan tetap bagus dan terjaga kondisinya,” jelasnya.
Wahab juga mengingatkan tentang kemasan pengiriman barang yang tergolong berisiko. Menurutnya, makanan sebaiknya dibungkus dengan plastik yang dilapisi styrofoam dan kotak.
“Supaya kita memastikan dia benar-benar aman sampai tujuan. Apalagi yang bahannya berminyak, agar tidak tumpah jadi packaging-nya harus rapi,” ungkapnya.

Tips for Selling Food Online to Maintain Quality
Nov 7 2019, 12:59 PM by Sarah Ervina Dara Siyahailatua, Yayuk Widiyarti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Businessmen have begun selling their wares in online stores. Not only clothing, also various food needs such as coffee and spices are offered via the internet.
However, if you are one of the people who are interested in selling food online, various things need to be considered. According to the owner of Rumah Bumbu Ratna, Abdul Wahab, an online food merchant must pay attention to the time of purchase of raw materials.
This is because the price of raw materials is volatile. For example, chili prices are soaring when approaching large events such as Ramadan and Christmas.
"We should stock up from afar, because orders for big days will definitely come high. We must learn so as not to lose and the price remains friendly to buyers, "he said at the Tokopedia media gathering in Makassar on November 7, 2019.
For online food sellers, Wahab also suggested choosing the best shipping and logistics company. For example, those who have high flying hours so the delivery time is certainly not too late.
"If possible, use an express or a maximum of five days to send it between islands so the food stays good and is in good condition," he explained.
Wahab also reminded about shipping packages that are classified as risky. According to him, food should be wrapped in plastic coated with Styrofoam and a box.
"So that we make sure he is really safe until the destination. Moreover, the ingredients are oily, so it does not spill so the packaging must be neat, "he said.
